text:

Twitter: @russwilliamsiii ID: 10749306 2. As well as people’s cremated ashes: View this image › 
fcaofmn.org ID: 10749300 3. And drugs, for people who are high enough to think they can get away with that. View this image › 
Twitter: @danalarsen ID: 10749301 4. But they don’t just deliver mail. They’re also basically therapists for anyone interested, which means they get the juiciest gossip 24/7. View this image › 
Twitter: @IMarriedaMoose ID: 10749364 5. They know who is cheating on their spouse: View this image › 
Twitter: @MarissaLinzey ID: 10749369 6. Who gets accepted to which colleges: View this image › 
Twitter: @ShellyPeskin Big envelope = accepted.
ID: 10749377 7. And they’re also one of the first to know who has died. View this image › 
Oxygen Cars with out-of-state license plates + mail buildup usually means the customer has passed.
ID: 10749409 8. The job can be really rewarding. Each year, postal workers respond to thousands of kids’ Christmas letters as Santa Claus. View this image › 
@JustJoshinMagic / Via imgur.com ID: 10749494 9. And they get to meet so many dogs. Yes, they love dogs… View this image › 
Ryan Schocket ID: 10749505 10. …even though many have been attacked by them. #MailmanProbs
— Gina (@ginakmiotek) Twitter: @ginakmiotek ID: 10749506 11. Postal workers have been through a lot, which is why most branches are so close. They often host benefits for workers and their families who need it, as well as other charities. View this image › 
Twitter: @SpoffordHome ID: 10749343 12. But that doesn’t mean there isn’t drama and fighting over routes, seniority, and personal stuff. People do go postal. View this image › 
NBC ID: 10749354 13. Wouldn’t you if you were stuck in a truck with AC that barely worked? View this image › 
@the.wicked.wench / Via instagram.com ID: 10749461 14. Or if you constantly had people trying to intercept credit card bills? View this image › 
Twitter: @CaitFarr ID: 10749421 15. And progress reports? View this image › 
Twitter: @_GibbY___ ID: 10749424 16. As a customer, there are just some things you shouldn’t do. Don’t be one of those people who waits for them at the mailbox everyday. View this image › 
nicotinenirvana.com It’s just annoying.
ID: 10749519 17. Don’t be one of those pranksters who leave them ~surprises~ in the mailbox. View this image › 
@reedikulus / Via imgur.com ID: 10750076 18. And, if possible, don’t forget to tip them during the holidays. View this image › 
@magnifique.le.flair / Via instagram.com “It hasn’t even been in a full year of carrying my new route, and I can tell my customers appreciate my service, and I appreciate the love in return dearly.”
ID: 10749524 19. And whatever you do, DO NOT BLOCK THE MAILBOX. View this image › 
Ryan Schocket DON’T BLOCK THE MAILBOX.
ID: 10749601 20. You avoid doing those things and you won’t just get their stamp of approval (which, by the way, they have to pay for)… View this image › 
@lkartero / Via instagram.com ID: 10757712 21. You two will probably become besties. View this image ›
